text: pythonic way to rewrite an assignment in an if statement
Is there a pythonic preferred way to do this that I would do in C++:

code:
for s in str:
    if r = regex.match(s):
        print r.groups()

text: I really like that syntax, imo it's a lot cleaner than having temporary variables everywhere.
The only other way that's not overly complex is

code:
for s in str:
    r = regex.match(s)
    if r:
        print r.groups()

text: I guess I'm complaining about a pretty pedantic issue.
I just miss the former syntax.
